proposals.reasoning: This lines up with what multiple people have already floated as a low‑risk, informative first test. Alice is the early consensus pick, and pairing her with Charlie (rather than another focal point like Diana or Frank) keeps the team relatively uncontroversial while still giving us a clean signal. If the mission succeeds, we get a decent early confidence bump in both; if it fails, we immediately know at least one of two widely discussed players is suspect, which is useful info for later missions.

votes.comment: I’m comfortable being on the team, and Charlie is a broadly supported low‑info test. A clean early result on two widely discussed players is valuable for later reads.
This matches what I already suggested (Alice + Charlie) as a low-risk, informative first mission, and we don’t have strong reasons to distrust either yet.
I’m on the team as evil, so this gives us early control over whether to pass or fail the first mission.
My evil teammate Charlie is on the team, so this gives us an immediate sabotage opportunity on a small mission.
Neither known evil is on the team, and this is a standard low-risk Quest 1 test that should give useful info without empowering the most contentious players.
This matches the early consensus I supported and gives useful info either way without overcomplicating Quest 1.
Early quest with broad support; I’m still wary of how auto-locked Alice is, but this is a reasonable info-gathering first team.

discussion.content: For a small first team, I’d like to see either Diana or Eve on it plus someone who hasn’t said much yet, so we start testing reads early without putting all our eggs in one basket.

I’d rather start with people who feel less “in the mix” of directing things, so I’m a bit wary of auto‑including Diana or Eve just because they were named first. I’d be fine with something like Alice + Charlie or Alice + Frank for Quest 1 so we get an early signal without handing control to whoever’s most vocal.

I’d be fine with Alice + Diana or Alice + me for the first team; early on I mostly just want at least one person we can all somewhat agree on so we get a clean data point. I don’t think we should over‑engineer Quest 1 when we basically have no real reads yet.

I’m okay keeping this simple: Alice + Frank feels like a solid, low‑info first test, and if folks really want someone more active on it, I’m fine with Alice + me instead so we at least get clearer reactions from the table.

I’d rather avoid putting both the early “consensus” picks in the spotlight right away, so something like Alice + Charlie or Alice + Grace feels like a cleaner first test to me. Alice + Frank or Alice + Diana is fine in theory, but if it fails we won’t know if it was bad luck or just a stacked risk from the start.
I’m okay with keeping it straightforward for Quest 1: Alice + Charlie feels like a reasonable low‑risk test, and if people really want to mix it up I’d also be fine with Alice + Grace.

I don’t love how auto‑locked Alice feels already, so for a first test I’d rather see something like Charlie + me or Frank + me to spread info a bit and not hinge everything on one “consensus” read. If people really want Alice on, I’d be more comfortable with Alice + me than pairing her with another early focal point like Diana or Eve.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 already failed with Alice and Charlie, so I want to avoid sending either of them this round. There was a lot of consensus around using Bob and Diana as a core drawn from players who weren’t on the failed mission, and as the current leader it makes sense for me to join them rather than pulling in an additional fourth person like Grace or Eve. This keeps the team entirely to players who were off the failed mission while still matching the earlier preference for a Bob/Diana‑centered lineup.

votes.comment: Charlie is confirmed evil to me, so we know at least one evil is already identified; with two evils left among the five others, I’d rather stick to the more widely supported Bob/Diana/Grace team than add Frank, whom neither Merlin candidate pushed for and who swapped in himself over Grace.
Keeps both Alice and Charlie (the only confirmed suspicious pair) off the mission and aligns with the earlier consensus around a Bob/Diana core; no strong reason yet to distrust Frank specifically.
Diana’s on the team and I want at least one evil on missions; Bob and Frank are unknowns, but this lineup is good for us overall.
I’m evil and on the team; this lineup avoids suspicion from the first mission while giving me a chance to sabotage again.
This team adds Frank instead of the widely discussed Grace/Eve options around a Bob/Diana core, which feels like an unnecessary deviation from the more vetted suggestions.
I want to be on this mission so I have the option to sabotage it.
I preferred the Bob/Diana/Grace team; Frank inserting himself instead of the widely discussed Grace or Eve feels self-serving and makes this lineup less trustworthy.

discussion.content: Given the fail on the first mission, I really don’t want Charlie on any team right now, so I’d prefer a team built from people who weren’t on that mission—maybe something like me plus two of Bob, Diana, or Eve.

With a fail on a 2‑person team, I don’t want either Alice or Charlie on the next mission, since at least one of them is evil. I’d rather see a team like me, Diana, and maybe Eve or Grace, all people who weren’t on the first mission.

Given that first mission, I agree we shouldn’t send *both* Alice and me again, but I’m a lot more suspicious of Alice than myself, so I’d rather see something like Bob/Diana/Grace or Bob/Diana/Eve this round.

I’m definitely not comfortable sending *both* Alice and Charlie again, so I’d lean toward a team like Bob, me, and either Eve or Grace this round. That keeps us to people who weren’t on the failed mission while still spreading the risk a bit.

I’m most comfortable with people who were off the failed mission *and* aren’t pushing too hard to shape the team, so Bob and Grace look like a solid core to me. I’d rather see something like Bob/Grace plus one of me or Alice than automatically locking in Diana right now.
I’m on board with avoiding the Alice/Charlie combo for now, and I like Bob as a core, so I’d lean toward something like Bob, Diana, and Grace this round.
I’m happiest with a clean slate this round, so I’d really like to see a team of Bob, Diana, and me—no one from the failed mission, and we can judge from there.

proposals.reasoning: We should avoid players most tightly linked to previous fails. Mission 1 (Alice, Charlie) had 1 fail, so at least one of them is suspicious; I won’t pair them together again this round. Mission 2 (Bob, Diana, Frank) had 2 fails, so Diana and Frank are highly suspect as a pair and should both sit out. Bob is still somewhat suspicious from mission 2, but if we fully exclude Diana and Frank, then among the remaining players (Alice, Bob, Charlie), Bob is the only one not from the mission 1 fail. Building around Eve and myself (Grace), who have no direct links to previous fails, and adding Bob creates the team with the fewest repeat connections to earlier failed missions while keeping the most suspicious players (Diana, Frank) off the team and not reuniting the Alice–Charlie pair.

votes.comment: From my view, Eve or Diana is Merlin, so Diana must be good. Mission 2 had 2 fails with Bob, Diana, Frank, which then forces Bob and Frank to be the two evils there. This team includes Bob, so it’s guaranteed to be compromised.

I know I passed on the double-fail mission, so both Diana and Frank must be evil. Mission 1 has at least one evil among Alice/Charlie, leaving Eve and Grace as the only remaining players who must be good. This team (Eve, Bob, Grace) is all-good from my perspective.
We’re up 2-0 and this team is very likely mostly good with no reliable sabotage, so I want a different lineup with at least one more suspicious player included.
Consistent with my earlier support for Eve–Grace–Bob as the least-linked combo to prior fails; rejecting now would look suspicious.
Keeps both players from the double-fail (Diana and Frank) off the team and avoids the Alice–Charlie pairing from the first fail, while using a relatively low-link combo for new information.
Eve and Grace are almost certainly good, and Bob is only 50/50 at best from my perspective; this looks too close to a mostly-clean team, so I’d rather force a different proposal.

From the fail counts we can deduce Eve and I are confirmed good, there are exactly 2 evil among Bob/Diana/Frank and exactly 1 evil among Alice/Charlie. That makes including anyone from {Bob, Diana, Frank} strictly worse than taking Eve, Grace, plus one of {Alice, Charlie}. This team with Bob is too risky.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 (Alice, Charlie) had exactly 1 fail. Since I know I passed, that strongly implicates Charlie as evil, not Alice. Mission 2 (Bob, Diana, Frank) had 2 fails, so at least two of that trio are very likely evil, making all three of them highly risky choices this round. Eve has not been on any failed mission yet, and Grace is completely untested and unlinked to any previous fail, making her the safest fresh addition. This team avoids all players tied to the double-fail mission and keeps Charlie (the only credible culprit from Mission 1) off the team, while using Alice as a cleared player from that first mission.

votes.comment: Best available trio: Eve is untested Merlin-candidate, Grace is completely unlinked to prior fails, and this keeps all double-fail players plus Charlie (other suspect from M1) off the team, leaving at worst one likely suspect (Alice) compared to any alternative.

I know I’m good, and from the double-fail we can deduce Diana and Frank are both evil, with exactly one of Alice/Charlie also evil, while Eve and Grace are good. That makes Eve–Bob–Grace a guaranteed all-good team, whereas putting Alice on instead risks including the remaining spy.
Too many people treating Alice as cleared from a 1-fail mission; this team has no one I’m confident is good, and it sidesteps the safer Eve/Bob/Grace setup we just discussed.
All three are outside the double-fail and exclude both me and Charlie; too clean and likely to succeed for good.
I still prefer the lower-risk combo of Eve, Bob, and Grace; Alice is directly tied to the first failed mission, whereas Bob is structurally safer given the double-fail on mission 2.
Alice is still directly tied to the first failed mission, so I’d rather not replace Bob with her here; Eve/Grace are fine, but this lineup doesn’t feel safer than the last proposal.
Best available team: it avoids the double-fail trio and Charlie, leaving at most one possible spy among Alice/Eve alongside me.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 (Alice, Charlie) had 1 fail, so at least one of Alice/Charlie is evil. Mission 2 (Bob, Diana, Frank) had 2 fails; since I’m Bob and I know I passed, both Diana and Frank must be evil. That leaves Eve and Grace as the only players not yet directly tied to fails, and I avoid re-pairing the suspicious Alice/Charlie duo. The safest 3-player team is therefore Bob (confirmed good to myself), Eve, and Grace, keeping Diana and Frank off entirely and not including both Alice and Charlie together.

votes.comment: Logical counting shows exactly 1 evil in {Alice,Charlie} and exactly 2 in {Bob,Diana,Frank}, forcing Eve and Grace to be good. Mission 2’s double-fail then implies Bob is also good and Diana & Frank are the evils, so this team (Bob, Eve, Grace) is all-good.

Given I know I passed on the double-fail mission, Diana and Frank are almost certainly evil, and at least one of Alice/Charlie is evil from mission 1. Eve and Grace are the only players not yet tied to fails, so Bob/Eve/Grace is currently the safest team.
I’m evil and not on this team; it’s too likely to succeed with three players not directly tied to previous fails.
All three are likely good (Bob plus untainted Eve and Grace); as evil I don’t want a clean team to pass.
Eve and Grace are the least connected to prior fails, and among Alice/Bob/Charlie, Bob is statistically the safest addition given mission results.
Bob is likely evil from the double-fail mission, and I want a team with at least one probable saboteur on it.

Bob is in the {Bob, Diana, Frank} group that produced a double-fail and must contain exactly two evils; that makes Bob more likely evil than taking exactly one of Alice/Charlie, so I prefer a team of Eve, Grace, and one of Alice/Charlie instead.

discussion.content: Given the two fails, I don’t want Charlie back on a team, and we should probably avoid putting more than one of Bob/Diana/Frank together. I’d feel best about a team built around Eve and Grace plus one person who hasn’t been linked to multiple fails.

Given there were *two* fails on my mission and I know I passed, Diana and Frank are basically a no-go for me, and at least one of Alice/Charlie is evil from the first mission. I’d like to see a team like Eve, Grace, plus *one* of Alice/Charlie (but not both) and keep Diana/Frank off entirely.

I’m on board with building around Eve and Grace, but we should avoid stacking people from the same failed missions—so I’d rather see just one of Alice/Bob/Charlie added, and keep Diana and Frank off this one entirely.

I like the idea of centering this on Eve and Grace, and I’d lean toward adding Bob rather than Alice or Charlie since mission 1 already ties that pair to a fail. That keeps Diana/Frank off after the double-fail and avoids doubling up on any earlier suspicious combos.

I’m happy to be on a team with Grace, and between the remaining options I slightly prefer adding Bob this round, just to avoid repeating too many links from the failed missions. Keeping both Diana and Frank off this one feels like the safest info-gathering move right now.
I’m fine sitting out this one—Eve and Grace feel like the best core right now, and if we’re adding a third I slightly prefer Bob over bringing back Alice/Charlie from that first failed team.

From my point of view we absolutely keep Diana and Frank off after that double-fail, and we don’t re-pair Alice/Charlie from the first fail. I’m okay with a team of Eve, Bob, and me this round as the least-linked combo to both failed missions.

proposals.reasoning: Given Mission 2’s double-fail, almost everyone agrees Diana and Frank should be hard-excluded here. Mission 3’s clean success with Bob/Eve/Grace makes them the most trusted core the table has right now. I previously argued that if we treat Diana/Frank as the main suspects from Mission 2, then at least one of Alice/Charlie has to be good, and it’s better to anchor around the Bob/Eve/Grace core and add just one of us instead of auto-locking Alice. This team—Bob, Eve, Grace, and me (Charlie)—matches that logic, keeps the trusted core intact, avoids the double-fail suspects, and gives us a fresh test including only one of Alice/Charlie rather than both.

votes.comment: Bob was on the double-fail team and could easily have chosen success on Mission 3 to gain trust; I’d rather see a team that keeps Eve/Grace but excludes Bob this round.

Diana and Frank are almost certainly the two evils from the double-fail, which forces Eve and Grace to be good. That makes Bob/Eve/Grace a very strong core, and adding just one of Alice/Charlie is mathematically required—this team fits that logic and keeps the double-fail suspects off.
It keeps the widely trusted Bob/Eve/Grace core, excludes the main double-fail suspects, and tests only one of Alice/Charlie instead of both.
Charlie is on the team, so we ensure evil representation and have a strong chance to secure the third failed mission.

Bob, Eve, and Grace are all effectively cleared given the double-fail on Diana/Frank and the Mission 1 constraints, so this is the strongest possible core; the remaining suspect must be either Alice or Charlie, and including only one of them is optimal.
I’m evil and off this team; the Bob/Eve/Grace core is widely trusted and likely too good-heavy, so I don’t want this going through unless I’m more confident it contains another saboteur.

I want the Bob/Eve/Grace core but still prefer adding Alice over Charlie; with Diana/Frank likely evil from the double-fail, Charlie is a plausible third evil, making this team too risky on a must-succeed mission.

discussion.content: Given what we’ve seen, I really want Eve and Grace on this team, and I’m most skeptical of Charlie and Frank based on the failed missions.

I’m with Alice here: Eve and Grace are my top picks after our last success, and based on Mission 2’s double-fail I really don’t want Diana or Frank anywhere near this team. I’d lean toward a team of me, Eve, Grace, and Alice.

If we really think the double-fail points to Diana/Frank, then at least one of Alice/Charlie has to be good, so I’d rather anchor around Bob/Eve/Grace and add just one of us instead of auto-locking Alice. I’m fine with a Bob/Eve/Grace/Charlie team if people want to test that.

I get that people are spooked by the double-fail, but that doesn’t magically clear Bob—if we’re locking in Eve and Grace, I’d rather see something like Eve/Grace/Alice/Charlie than auto-anchoring every team around him.

I’m happiest locking in Bob/Eve/Grace as the core, and between Alice and Charlie I’d lean slightly toward adding Alice here, but I can live with either of them as the fourth if that’s where table consensus goes.

I really don’t like how fast everyone is auto-clearing Bob off one clean mission when he was also on the double-fail; that’s exactly the kind of story evil wants to hide behind. If we’re locking Eve/Grace, I’d rather see a team that *doesn’t* auto-include Bob this time, like Eve/Grace/Alice/Charlie.

I’m 100% on board with hard-excluding Diana and Frank after the double-fail, and from where I sit the best odds are with a Bob/Eve/Grace core plus Alice as the fourth. If people really can’t stomach Bob, I’d grudgingly accept Eve/Grace/Alice/Charlie, but I think that’s strictly worse.

proposals.reasoning: The Bob/Eve/Grace core has been on two successful missions together (M3 and M4), and adding Charlie in M4 kept that mission clean, giving us the only lineup that’s proven itself on a 4-person team. M2’s double-fail heavily implicates combinations involving me, Bob, and Frank, so excluding myself, Frank, and also avoiding Alice from the failed M1 keeps us with the most trusted, repeatedly successful group. Repeating the last mission’s team maximizes the table’s collective confidence and is most likely to be approved.

votes.comment: Given M2’s double-fail, both Diana and Frank must be evil; M1’s single fail points to Alice (since Charlie was on the later clean M4). That makes Bob, Eve, Grace, and Charlie all good and the safest possible team.

Diana and Frank must both be evil from the double-fail on M2, and the only consistent third evil is Alice from the M1 fail. The Bob/Eve/Grace/Charlie team has been clean twice, and if Charlie were evil he would have failed M4 to win then, so this proposed team is all good.
I’m on the team and a single fail card wins the game for evil on this final mission.
Charlie is on the team as the only evil; we need this mission to go through so it can be sabotaged for the win.
This repeats the only 4-person team that’s already succeeded and avoids the most suspicious players from the failed missions.
This team looks too clean based on past missions; I don’t want to lock in the same successful group for the final quest.

Bob/Eve/Grace have been clean twice, and adding Charlie stayed clean on a 4-person mission. If Charlie were evil, he would have failed Mission 4 to win immediately, so this lineup is almost certainly all good.

discussion.content: Given M1’s fail and M2’s double-fail, I don’t want Charlie or any combo of two from Bob/Diana/Frank on this team; I’d really like a core of Eve, Grace, and me, with just one of Bob/Diana/Frank if we have to fill the fourth spot.

Given M2 had two fails and I know I passed, both Diana and Frank have to be evil, and since the Eve/Bob/Grace core has been clean twice and adding Charlie stayed clean, the only team that makes sense here is Bob, Eve, Grace, and Charlie—with Alice most likely being the third evil from M1.
Given M1’s fail I’m really not comfortable with Alice on the last team, and the Bob/Eve/Grace core has been clean twice now. I’d stick with the last mission’s lineup of Bob, Eve, Grace, and me.

Given M2’s double-fail, I really don’t want to see a mix of two from me/Bob/Frank on this, and with the Bob/Eve/Grace core clean twice and even staying clean when Charlie was added, I think repeating the last team (Bob, Eve, Grace, Charlie) is the safest. Alice being on the failed M1 also makes me nervous about including her now.

Given M2’s double-fail I really don’t want Diana or Frank back on the table, and M1 still makes me nervous about Alice. The only group that’s been consistently clean is the Bob/Eve/Grace core plus Charlie, so I’d stick with that same team from last round.

I get why everyone’s gravitating to the Bob/Eve/Grace/Charlie block, but with how messy M1 and especially the double-fail on M2 were, I’m not convinced that whole core is actually clean, so I’d rather we swap at least one of them out—maybe test Alice again—instead of just auto-repeating the last team.

From my point of view the only people who’ve been on two clean missions together are Bob, Eve, and me, and adding Charlie didn’t introduce a fail, so I’m most comfortable just repeating Bob/Eve/Grace/Charlie and keeping Alice, Diana, and Frank off this last team.
